p: Surgery and radiation therapy were the most preferred means of treatment to control cancer before 1950 and after 1960, respectively [ 4]. Chemotherapy can be done before surgery to shrink the tumor or after surgery to kill the remaining cancer cells [ 5]. However, most of the chemotherapeutic drugs lack specificity and tend to rapidly damage normal dividing tissues, causing side effects such as immunosuppression, neurotoxicity, and hair loss [ 6]. Moreover, resistance has also reduced therapeutic efficacy of some anticancer chemotherapeutic drugs [ 7].
